Lasioglossum ( Evylaeus ) sphecodicolor Sakagami & Tadauchi, 1995: 191
, figs 52, 55, 57, 59, 61–65, 67–68 ( ♀ ♂ ) ( holotype : Systematic Entomology, Faculty of Agriculture, Hokkaido University, Japan , ♀ , type locality =Takizawa Experim. Forest, Iwate Pref. , N. Honshu, Japan ).

Females are similar to
L. ( H. ) eidmanni (Blüthgen, 1930)
. According to Sakagami & Tadauchi (1995) , this species is only separated from
L . ( H .) eidmanni
by the metasomal terga without distinct apical fimbriae. In contrast, in
L. ( H. ) eidmanni
, the metasomal terga have more or less dense and welldeveloped apical fimbriae.
